profile_positions.description:
Joanne van der Leun (1963) is full Professor of Criminology at Leiden Law school, Leiden University. Since 2001 she is working as a criminologist. She was one of the pioneering staff members of the Criminology programmes at Leiden Law School. 
She was Academic Director of the Institute for Criminal Law & Criminology (2014-2016) and Program Director of the bachelor and masters of Criminology (2008-2014). She has taught a large number of  courses at Leiden Law School. She participates in several Editorial Boards and Committees. She has given many guest lectures at other universities including lectures for PhD students in Florence, Milano, and Coimbra. She has been Leadership coach for several years.    
Her research interest lie in the field of urban issues of crime and migration and policies to combat crime and migration crime. She has primarily been involved in interdisciplinary research projects, both nationally and internationally. Her 2010 Inaugural Lecture dealt with the issue of Crimmigration: the melting of Criminal Law and Migration Policy. She is active member of the CINETS network: Crimmigration Control - International Net of Studies. 
She was trained at Utrecht University in Interdisciplinary Social Sciences (MA) with a specialisation in Urban Studies. She holds a PhD d in Sociology (Eramus University 2001). Her thesis: Looking for Loopholes. Processes of incorporation of illegal immigrants in the Netherlands was published in 2003 by the Amsterdam University Press.
profile_positions.title: Professor of Criminology at Leiden Law School
Decaan Faculteit der Rechtsgeleerdheid / Dean Leiden Law School

company.name: ACVZ Advisory Committee on Migration Affairs

profile_positions.company: ACVZ Advisory Committee on Migration Affairs
profile_positions.description: This independent committee, consisting of 10 members, advises the national government on migration policy and migration law. In most cases it directly advises the State Secretary of Security and Justice
profile_positions.title: Member

company.name: Ministry of Security & Justice Accreditation Committe for Behavioural Interventions

profile_positions.description:
The Erkenningscommissie Gedragsinterventies Justitie (Ministry of Security & Justice Accreditation
Committee for Behavioural Interventions) has been assigned a significant role in the creation of a limited range of judicial behavioural interventions which, if implemented and executed correctly, should help to reduce reoffending.
profile_positions.title: Member
